task_summary: The robot arm must avoid the obstacle (books) on the table and reach the blue pen at the far side of the books.

task_long_description.overview: This scene takes place on a tabletop where a robot arm must move its end-effector from one side of a stack of books (serving as an obstacle) to reach a blue pen placed in a holder on the far side. The books block direct access; the robot must first perceive the pen, plan a safe path, move above or around the obstacle, and approach the pen.
preconditions: Robot arm is initialized and homed
Obstacle (stack of books) and blue pen are visible on the table
No objects obstructing overhead movement path
stepwise_plan: Detect if the blue pen is visible; if not, scan the area
Raise above obstacle to avoid collision
Approach and align precisely towards blue pen
success_criteria: End-effector reaches a position above or at the blue pen
Pen is reached without disturbance to books or other objects
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive pen: scan area up to 3 times
Collision risk: ensure raise above obstacle before approach
task_long_description.termination: Task completes successfully when robot is at/above blue pen, or after repeated detection failures.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: avoid obstacle and reach the blue pen

node_specs.description: Checks if blue pen is visible to the robot sensors
Scans the tabletop in a grid pattern to locate the blue pen
Performs sensor-based detection of the blue pen
Raises the arm above the obstacle (books) ensuring collision avoidance
Moves the arm to a position above the blue pen
Approaches and aligns precisely with the blue pen
Verifies robot is at the target (blue pen)

failure_modes: Pen not initially visible due to occlusion
Error in detection or approach phase
recovery_strategy: Scan area up to three times for the blue pen
Always move above obstacle before approaching target
assumptions: Obstacle is identified visually as stack of books in frames, not strictly named in instruction
Pen referenced as 'blue_pen'; assumed target in both instruction and frames
No interaction such as grasp; only approach and reach

expected_success_criteria: Robot reaches above the blue pen
